intro: Eremothera boothii subsp. alyssoides, commonly known as the Desert Alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of yellow or white flowers that bloom in spring. It is well adapted to dry environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in poor soil conditions. Its botanical features make it a hardy and drought-tolerant species often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
